title: Limit Outdoor Time
description: Avoid long walks in freezing temperatures. Short, frequent walks keep pets warm and safe.

title: Protect Their Paws
description: Use pet-safe booties or paw balms to prevent frostbite and dryness caused by snow and salt.

title: Keep Them Dry
description: Always dry your petâ€™s coat and paws after coming inside to avoid chills or skin irritation.

title: Warm Bedding Matters
description: Provide soft, elevated bedding away from cold floors and drafts. Heated pads can help too!

title: Adjust Their Diet
description: Pets may need a little extra food in winter to maintain body heat, but avoid overfeeding.

title: Watch for Hypothermia Signs
description: Shivering, lethargy, or whining can signal that your pet is too cold. Keep them indoors.
